channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Multiple potholes on dunster road, 7th September
item.description:
The location is where Wentworth Road joins into Dunster Road with multiple deep potholes affecting cars noticeable to walkers by. The road needs to be taken its surface right down and relaid. Of interest to the council re people claiming damage to vehicles. I cannot measure them but they are all varied and also dangerous as a trip hazard for those crossing the road especially the elderly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Dunster Road, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Willowleaze, Longlevens, Gloucester

item.title: Hazel hedgerow overgrown Green Lane Hucclecote GL3 3RP, 7th September
item.description:

item.title: Red barriers still on fence, 7th September
item.description:
Hi these red barriers were placed here in January due to a reported sunk pavement. Please can I have an update as to what is currently being investigated? Can the reason for the pavement issues be confirmed. If there is a fault with the pavement does a new ticket need to be raised? These barriers seem to be left here with no future work happening. Do they need to be removed?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Great Western Terrace, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Tree limbs overgrown and posing a potential hazzard to road users, 7th September
item.description:
The trees at the end of Oldbury Road have grown so large that they have started shedding branches and also pose a hazzard to double decker buses during school times. Can the please be Pollarded / cut back the same as the other trees in this area. The major limbs of the tree are also posing a potential risk of falling off. They have also grown very near and over telephone lines. Thus has been reported repeatedly over the last few years but nothing has Bern done. Many road users and pedestrians use this road particulary during school timed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, Oldbury Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No a pot hole per se, but huge puddle of water collects when it rains, 7th September
item.description:
At traffic lighted pedestrian crossing. when it rains a huge puddle collects. cars turning left into Shelburne road unavoidably splash the pedestrians. pedestrians have to either jump over or walk through the puddle. road needs building up to stop the pooling of water.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 88a, Lansdown Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A sofa and shopping trolly full of rubbish fly tipped, 7th September
item.description:
A sofa and a shopping trolly full of rubbish have been fly tipped both thes have both Bern there for many days. Both cause potential risk to traffic.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Oldbury Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Barriers And tree stumps still here over 4yrs on, 7th September
item.description:
Hello Can I bring to your attention the mess on Windyridge Road on Wymans Brook for approximately 4years now we have had an eyesore outside out property (14 Limber Hill) Gloucestershire council cut down two trees due to them causing subsistence to my property and were ment to return to grind down the stumps ..They put barriers around both tree stumps and that’s how it’s been since then We have contacted Glos Highways on several occasions (via phone) including other residents over this time and nothing has been done so far ….so I’m hoping this email might get this job completed and the unsightly barriers removed Thankyou for your attention Regards Mike Homer ￼ ￼ ￼ ￼ ￼ ￼ ￼ ￼ ￼

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Windyridge Road, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unclear road markings, 7th September
item.description:
All along the recently resurfaced Pittville Road there is heavy vegetation litter as well as grass and other smaller plants taking root. Many double yellow line markings are unclear as well as small drainage issues. As the road was only resurfaced 1 year ago it would be great if the relevant department could do regular cleans to keep it looking new for as long as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15-27, Pittville Circus Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Impassable footpath, 7th September
item.description:
After moderate rain surface water is present under the bridge on Market St. This is not only an obstruction to cyclists, but also makes the path unusable for pedestrians and wheel chair users whereby they may have to walk in the run facing oncoming traffic.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Market Street, St Paul’s, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavements in General, 7th September
item.description:
All round the close- pavements and road in poor condition. Could do with patching & being on a planned repair list
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cousley Close, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Corner of Green Lane/Billbrook Rd, 7th September
item.description:
Consistently having vehicles park right on the corner of the junction. Had a very near miss as traffic on Billbrook cannot see out to Green Lane & when turning into Billbrook from Green Lane, you can’t see cars coming from Billbrook. This is getting worse and worse and it will only be a matter of time before there is a serious accident.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Billbrook Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: B4063 Hare and Hounds -Traffic light sequence causing huge traffic delays, 6th September
item.description:
Traffic lights at Hare and Hounds on B4063 now 4 way and causing chaos. Cars coming from Elmbridge Court Roundabout are queuing from the roundabout in rush hour, all the way to the H&H lights as the sequence of lights limits how many cars can through on green. Please can a review of these lights take place. They used to be 2 way. Today it was noted the traffic was jamming on the Elmbridge Court Roundabout causing chaos to cars trying to enter the roundabout to get onto B4063.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parton Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working
